Headline: Unfortunately, these are not concave enough and press on my eyes.  Loosening the strap doesn't help as that makes the mask too loose and it doesn't stay in place.
Review Text: This mask would be great for kids or someone with a very small face and head. I read the reviews and people raved about this mask but i will never buy these masks again.I first thought wow three for a small price but i thought that they would be better quality then what they are. When i first put it on it was clear that the mask definitely would slide off my head from the soft material because the band is just a cheap elastic with and adjuster but you have to almost have no blood flow to your eyes if you want it to say on. The mask is slightly bigger then my tv remote. You will be able to see light through the noise hold easily. Its irritating when you are a light sleeper and very sensitive to light. The three pack is nice when it comes to buying them when needing multiple. But i will be definitely be spending a little more money when it comes to buying a different mask. It does feel like a cheap memory foam shoe insert that was made into a sleeping mask. I dont know how long it will hold up to being used long term.Update: customer service reached out to me about this review. They did refund me $15 which is greatly appreciated. They gave me a choice to either receive $15 compensation or a updated version of the masks. But they do beg for you to take it down or update it to 4 stars and then try to use the current situation to try and change your opinion to a 4 star review. I just dont think the product deserves a 4 star solely based on the product itself. I understand during the pandemic its hard on everyone but I do want the product to speak for itself then give false information.

Headline: TWO BROS REVIEW SAY: Best way to get rid of eye strain
Review Text: I decided to try these masks based on the excellent value - 3 masks for very little money. This was to replace a Nidra masks that I have been using with love for years but was falling apart. This mask is no where as comfortable as the Nidra mask because it rubs on the top edge of my ears. Ill probably keep these as a back up and buy myself another set of Nidras. Im a small woman so the smaller size should work but it just doesnt. Maybe they are better on bigger heads. Quality is very good however and will probably last a long time.

Headline: These masks hold the cold well help for eye pain.
Review Text: The band tighteners make it difficult to sleep on your side...which i do. Have stopped using these.

Headline: I love this sleep mask. It helps with a headache. Its very comforatable and soft.
Review Text: Hey everyone, Two Bros Review here, as always we are on youtube for more indepth analysis. First off this was a personal purchase for me since I wear glasses and was suffering from eye strain. Enter this mask right here. Not only did it get rid of eye strain quickly but it helped ease headaches. The price was worth the quality of this product since after heavy use it has no damage and it stays cold. Overall a definite BUY from us.

Headline: It's really is an amazing product. It helps me sleep so much better but it does kinda hurt on the ears like a tiny bit but afterwards it fine
Review Text: I have both eye pain from Thyroid eye and dry eye and migraines and Ive used them for both.  The fact that they are weighted improves the effect of the cold.

Headline: This sleep mask is so nice! Really good quality and I especially love that it can be refrigerated/frozen
Review Text: I love this mask so much Ive bought it several times! This is the perfect weight to help with sleep and/or to help with my headache pain. I love to pop it in the freezer for a bit and then put it on. It feels so soothing and retains the cool for quite a long time! The strap is super easy to adjust, and its just adorable. When I get a headache I almost always get pressure around my eyes. This baby helps alleviate that so well! I lost my first one in a very unfortunate Im an idiot accident, and I knew I couldnt be without it so ordered a second time. Comes fast, doesnt have a funky smell, and is super helpful!
I love the material of this mask, doesn't seem too weighted so I'm anxious to try out tonight after chilling it

Headline: they are tiny and move around at night
Review Text: Buy this. Instantly obsessed with it

Headline: These work good enough but the pockets inside are not as deep as the said and I wish I would have gotten the ones with the nose shield to keep out light better. The do still slide a little but I can deal with that. They are soft and comfortable, so far no other issues.
Review Text: Best sleep mask I have ever had. I get migraines, so I needed something that was darkening and light weight. This one is great. The strap isnt to tight and u can adjust it. The weight is just right, heavy enough for sinus pain, but not heavy enough to add to a headache. U can also put it in the freezer and get it cold, it does not freeze. I have very long, natural eye lashes as well, the "z" print lets me open and close my eyes if I need to... just perfect for me all around. So glad I got this.

Headline: Feel like swimming goggles
Review Text: the material is soft, and the issue is so tiny that at night as i toss and turn they move out of my eyes, and i wake up to move them into position a couple of times a night when light coming from outside wakes me up.

Headline: I thought these were the same as Netflix Russian Doll version
Review Text: Product is different, lower quality over time

Headline: There's better versions out there
Review Text: I saw the reviews and thought this should be perfect BUT it is not for side sleepers. The mask is so thick that is uncomfortable and it has to be wore very tight for the light not to come through. I am very disappointed with this product.

Headline: They block the light!
Review Text: They are ok- the fabric is soft and they block the light well. however, I often wake in the night Feeling like I'm wearing a pair of swimming goggles. I prefer the sleep masks that are a flat piece of fabric. These have padding that is supposed to sit on the outer bony part of your eye socket, so nothing touches your eye ball. But they shift in the night and I end up with the padding pressed against my eye ball.

Headline: Great design but needs better craftsmanship
Review Text: I thought I was buying the same ones pictured here from the Netflix series Russian Doll, but they are slightly different. Im not able to get the same fit as what I expected. I really like that I can open my eyes with the mask on. The fabric fiber makes very small stretching noises while I sleep. So they work but not as well as I would have hoped. From a sensory perspective, this could be improved but its still a great value for 2 pairs. Nice packaging. I am sure fabric is described somewhere but I dont always read details. I expected neoprene and its foam covered in something like spandex which us why you get the stretching noise.

Headline: Not a nice fit around my eyes
Review Text: Depending on your eye mask experiences will depend on your critique of this item. I, however, had the cr??me de La cr??me of eye masks, which was similar to this but much better quality that I had received as a gift. Being a cheap ass, I saw the bundle of 3 thinking that these would be on par. Now, had I not experienced the top tier eye mask prior to this, I'd probably go 4 stars, but in comparison, these are cheap. I have a feeling they will deteriorate within months. They aren't nearly as comfortable, albeit comfortable enough. there's no cooling gel around the eyes, and overall just feels meh. I will use these, but will be spending money ($20/mask) on the better quality version of this mask in the futureThey do however block out all light so that's good!

These masks are a great price for 3, and once you get the fit settled they block light very well. My problem is they press ever so gently ony sinus cavities, and before the first hour of the night Im experiencing a sinus headache. So I havent worn them all night yet. The foam is soft, but its a little hot. I tried loosening the strap, but then they gapped or fell off. I dont think they are going to work for me.

Headline: Comfortable, But Not Very Effective
Review Text: Update: having had these for 3 or 4 months, while I still love the design, the fabric is separating from the foam on the inner part (concave) facing the eyes. As such, it can now touch my eyes at times, and since avoiding that is one of the main features, they are not nearly as good once that happens. I can probably save them with a few stitches of thread near the center. Perhaps the company should consider adding something like that to the next version.Initial review: I have tried probably about 7 or 8 types of sleep mask, ranging from cheap to expensive, simple to a bit overdesigned, and these are the best ones yet for me. I like how the headband is adjustable but stays the way I set it. The mask is slightly cushioned, which is comfortable. It does a better job than most at blocking out light in the nose area. The shape of the mask is dimpled inward just enough to avoid pressing on your eyes.I am happy enough with these that I will probably buy more, even though I got three in this order.

Headline: This is the second time I purchased these. They work excellent out of the package.But after a couple months, the head strap elastic stretches out. You can adjust it, but it reaches a point where even that doesn't work.I guess that is ok, because around the same time the foam in the mask loses its shape. My eye lashes brushed against the mask waking me up again.As long as you expect to replace them every six months, they're good.
Review Text: These sleep masks are really soft, but they do have a tendency to move around on my face at night. If you only want them to keep the light out, then they are pretty great. I got them because I have overly dry eyes and keep to keep moving air and debris away from my eyes while I sleep. There is not a great fit around my eyes, so I am waking up with my eyes dried out from the wind they are supposed to be protecting me from.Otherwise they are great masks.

Headline: I suffer from headaches so I like total darkness! These let light in around the nose. I have a different brand that have more of a shell type cup these are just soft fabric. My other ones hug around my nose. Because these are a soft fabric they dont mold around your nose area leaving a gap for light to enter. They are thick enough that no light shines thru the fabric though. The strap loosens easily so Im not sure how it would be sleeping in it. Seems like mask would loosen and come off.
Review Text: The sleep mask I recently tried was a mixed bag. While it was comfortable to wear, I found that it wasnt very effective in helping me sleep.On the positive side, the sleep mask was very soft and comfortable to wear. The material was gentle on my skin and didnt cause any irritation or discomfort. The mask also fit well and stayed in place during the night, which was great.However, I found that the mask didnt block out light very well. It was marketed as a blackout mask, but I could still see light leaking in from the sides and bottom of the mask. This made it difficult to fall asleep, especially if youre sensitive to light.Another issue I had with the mask was that it didnt stay cool throughout the night. The material tends to trap heat, which can be uncomfortable, especially during the summer months.Overall, while the sleep mask was comfortable to wear, I wouldnt recommend it to those who are looking for a truly effective blackout mask. If youre a light sleeper who is sensitive to light, you may want to look for a mask that provides better light-blocking capabilities.

Headline: Well made but they bulge out and they slipped off in the night.
Review Text: Works fairly well for my CPAP mask (ResMed Airfit F20 full face mask)

Headline: The straps move around a lot when you sleep on your sides or back. When this happens, the grooves of the mask will sit on your eye and it's uncomfy. The holes don't always align with your eyes. These would only be perfect if they're used on a plane or if you're a back sleeper.
Review Text: Not good if you like total darkness

Headline: Definitely not Bucky brand
Review Text: I just received my mask yesterday. Uncomfortable my mask kept coming off because of my hair. My hair is straight so it wont stay in place. The bands are too narrow. I tightened it all it did was make the eye cup smash my eyes.but I wish they worked nice around the outer part of the eye. But I think the cups need to be a little deeper.

Headline: Light leak around your nose.
Review Text: Straps are uncomfy, but as expected

they simply werent large enough. the eye covering cup was smaller, and the length of the bike coverings in the front not including strap is not long enough. The mask I use from bed bath and beyond which are no longer available measured 9 " the eye piece at widest part measured 3.5". These mask measure 7 5/8" x 3 1/8".The strap is nicer than the old ones with  adjustable elastic. There is no Velcro. .I do not want to pull these really tight around my head, so these  just didnt work for me for those reasons only. I do not want to pull these really tight around my head. they are well-made and a good price, but too small.

Headline: Nce coverage but very tight
Review Text: Because of the price difference I really wanted to like these. I have a pair of Bucky 40 Winks eyeshade and honestly, they are the bomb. These are not. As soon as I put them on and seated them on my face there was that cursed light leak around my nose. When I put on eye shades I expect instant inky blackness. Nothing else will do. Even after I adjust these to blackness if I so much as raise my eyebrows that damn light shows up again. I suspect these might work for smaller faces but I'm built like a linebacker and have a face to match so??back they go unfortunately. Now that my curiosity is satisfied I will happily pay for another pair of Buckys.

Headline: Packaging was secure and interesting
Review Text: I've adjusted as much as possible but still light leaks around your nose.  I've washed them, so I'll keep them but would not recommend.

Headline: Seems like decent quality but I didnt like this mask because of its odd fit. Its a bit small so either I have the puffy rim pressing against the bottom eyelid or if I pull it down its putting pressure on my nose. Id say I have a pretty average sized face! Could work for someone smaller.
Review Text: The eye covering is soft, pliable, provides good fit and good coverage, but the elastic back band at its loosest setting is still very, very tight on my quite average sized woman's head. I cut one and stitched an elastic insert into the original elastic band, and I am experimenting with 'stretching?? another of the 3 mask set, as elastic will eventually loosen as it is stretched over time.  I like the eye/face piece in each mask, and I can make them work with an adaption, but I was surprised at the extreme tightness of the elastic back band.

Headline: They aren't that great, I wore them for four nights to try and see if I'd get used to it but I barely slept for four nights in a row. Kept sliding around whenever I moved but if I tightened it I'd get a headache. You get what you pay for I guess
Review Text: Material feels good and shape to keep off eyes but they are so much smaller than my previous ones that needed replacing.  As a side sleeper, the size is too small and lets light on and moves off my face too easily.  Since I missed the window for return I plan to keep them for airplane travel since they were inexpensive enough that if I lose them I wont be so sad.

Headline: Very soft but nose piece does not stay molded well
Review Text: Odd size and shape, uncomfortable

Headline: I like how soft and light weight they are.They claim it Perfectly matches your nose, it does not mine, no matter how tight i make it so no matter how i sleep, light comes through between my eye and nose.They also say its great for side sleepers, Im a side sleeper most nights and as soon as I roll on my side, no matter how tight it is, a lot of light comes in between the eye and nose.Ive definitely had better as far as light not coming in
Review Text: Get what you pay for I guess lol

Headline: So many people said these truly were complete blackout even by the nose area. I was excited! Finally!I opened the package, adjusted for the size of my head and... light was coming thru the nose area!I repositioned and adjusted bur it was no use.I need complete blackout so that during a migraine I dont have to lie in bed with a blanket over my head to keep the light out.
Review Text: Its comfortable when sleeping on side and I dont have any eye pressure but I wish the bridge was shorter.  For it to completely stay off the eyes, it puts pressure on bridge of nose.
Super soft & confortable but the nose piece tends to make the mask slip up during sleep. Still use  but can be frustrating in the middle of the night slipping up

Headline: Extension wearers beware!
Review Text: Dont quite live up to the hype.

Headline: Buckles on the side, bad design
Review Text: The price is good for three masks but I don't love the fit. The masks are very padded but not very contoured so they lay against my eyes but also leave gaps for light around my nose. I sleep on my stomach/side so they move around a bit. They might be better for a back sleeper. I will keep looking for a better fit.

Headline: This let light in. And when I tighten it to where it did not let light in, left sores on my ears. The strap is not comfortable and tangled in my hair (when it was in a bun). This product might work best for a male. Or someone with a larger head and shorter hair.
Review Text: I bought these masks to protect my eyelash extensions while I sleep. They looked exactly as advertised out of the package, however during use, the round part over the eyes creased horizontally across the mask, making the material lay directly on my eyes. Literally the exact opposite of what they are advertised to do. They look nice but are cheaply made and very flimsy.

Headline: I bought these for travelling to Europe.  I hoped (and thought) that the description was accurate and that the area over the eyes were distended enough so that my eyelashes wouldnt be smooshed.  There is no hope of preserving my make
Review Text: The buckles on the sides for the straps are uncomfortable & a bad design. I returned them

Headline: I returned these almost immediately because the fit was so bad. In order for them to fit snugly, I had to tighten the headband which caused the mask to gap and allow light to beam directly onto my eyes. They were soft though.
Review Text: Some people like these. Not sure why. I guess they do keep out the light but the material is not comfortable at all. I usually buy silk sleep masks but wanted to give these a try just for the heck of it. Threw them out after a few uses. Going back to my usual silk ones. So much more comfortable.

Headline: Ive purchased different types of these masks in the past. These ones arent the best. The bubble area for your eyes is really thick and high so when I lay on my side, it concaves in and presses on my eyeball defeating the purpose.
Review Text: Eye socket area presses against eyelashes
These are ok for the price, but light still comes n around the nose so this would be best used in a less lighted space.

Headline: Uncomfortable and light gets in
Review Text: Disappointing!!! The mask creases in the middle right across my eyelids. The elastic slips and the pieces holding the elastic to the mask become very uncomfortable and hurt behind my ears. I plan to return these. I do not recommend them.

Headline: Ive purchased multiple times. I do not recommend the new version.
Review Text: I am very disappointed with this sleep mask.  It is NOT 100% blackout.  It does not adequately shut out light no matter how I adjust the strap.  Also, the contour eye area is not high enough to avoid my eye lashes from brushing against the material and eye makeup gets all over it.  There are better eye masks out there like Bucky sleep masks.  Would not recommend this mask.

Headline: I like them as they help me sleep but  the strap is way loose no and I have only worm it or a little over a week.
Review Text: The eye mask seems so promising. It would probably be OK if you were on a plane sitting predominantly upright and would be helpful if you had make up on to protect it. I did not like it. I use an eye mask almost every morning and this one just did not work for me is it let in light.

Headline: For my particular face shape, they did not really fit, and light seeped around the nose bridge. Ill keep them for emergency use, but otherwise, I couldnt use them. On the other hand a friend liked them just fine so she got two of them.
Review Text: I purchased a few years ago and then again a few weeks ago. They are worlds different! The new one is stiff and bunches/pushes too much around the top of nose. :(
i have worn it for a little over a week and the strap is too loose.  It stresses out fast

Headline: Likes: Blocks out most light. Inexpensive.  Eyecups do not  delaminate like some eye masks.  Elastic band with small metal clip is better than thick overlapping velcro straps for back
Review Text: Did not fit my face properly

Headline: I bought them for deeper eye cups and 100% light blockage.  These do neither.  Very flat eye cups and gaps around both sides of the nose.  You cannot blink your eyes when the mask is on without vyour eyelids and lashes against the mask, which to me is a sign of SHALLOW eye cups.  They come packaged in a FLAT, vacuum
Review Text: The mask shifts around every time I move, even when tight

Headline: I have been using the black one for a little over a week, maybe two weeks and I am not pleased with it.1. Yes it is soft2. Light comes in under the lower eyes and around the nose3. The strap slips of my head during the night and I wake up looking for the mask4. If I tighten it so it doesn't skip off the the back of my head the (bra looking eye cups) push into my eyes
Review Text: Wears out quickly. Could use better design and material.
Misleading photos and descriptions

Headline: Technically works but very uncomfortable
Review Text: Keep looking- pay a little more for better quality

Headline: The part the cover the eyes is structurally to soft. The bubble eye cover breaks down super easy from accidentally sitting on it to if your head is bigger it stretches the covering send flattens it. Same for if you sleep on the side of your face.Also the part that holds the elastic band is poorly constructed as it flips because it is not made to securely hold that band on the plastic loop
Review Text: 1. Theyre rigid, so they dont quite cut out the light from the sides, which is pretty important2. The band is right in the middle, so it either goes right above your ears or over your ears, meaning its uncomfortable in any case, and you cant tighten too much (which would help problem #1)

Headline: Ive had these eye masks for nearly a month now; and after trial and error, I have to stop using them. These are thin and not
Review Text: It technically works in that it blocks out light and doesnt place any pressure on the eyeballs. However, it is uncomfortable in every other aspect. The material is a little bit rough and very irritating on the skin, especially if it is dry. It doesnt place any pressure on the eyeballs, but it places a lot of pressure on the outline of the mask which is uncomfortable. And itll easily shift around your face if you move your cheeks around at all.

Headline: If you want to have something fall apart in your sleep best product to get first one I grabbed in the first day of using it the band is already shredded going to try the next one hopefully it's just the one that's bad
Review Text: Sliders in the wrong place for side sleepers

Headline: I tend to sleep on my side with my face half buried in the pillow. That causes the 3D part of this to put pressure on my eye. Not good IMO. It can also allow light to leak in around the nose. Ive gone back to larger, flat mask and am happy I did.
Review Text: One of the more uncomfortable sleep masks I've ever purchased. The bubbled out effect on the eyes results in increased pressure around the eyes. It ends up creating a very uncomfortable sensation no matter how the band is adjusted. When you roll onto your side, the eye area ends up getting pushed in and creates an awkward, wrinkled sensation. Overall light blocking coverage is good though. I wear this one in a pinch, but will have to purchase something more comfortable for every day use.

Headline: Good concept; bad execution
Review Text: This looks like a little bra, but does not fit like one. I am looking for a blackout mask that blocks all light, doesnt leave marks in the morning, doesnt turn to the side at night, and you wont have to tighten mask down.This mask lets light in, leaves marks, turns to the side at night and has to be super tight to even be close to effective.Move on from this one.
Not a fan of the 3D part

Headline: Was nice at first, but quickly flattened out
Review Text: As a personal preference I use domed eye masks so they don't actually touch my eyes.  I've bought others on Amazon which did that. I thought these would be the same, they're not.  Once you go to tighten the adjustable strap, the tension cause the dome around the eye to fold and make eye contact with your eye lid.  Absolute deal breaker.  If you like that, maybe not so bad, but these don't hold the shape they're supposed to.

Headline: Strap.isnt in the right place for my liking. Have to push it up towards the crown of my head so strap.wont bother my ears but that adds pressure below my eyes. My 5 yr old loves them so,gave them to him. Good at blocking out light and soft though
Review Text: The fabric part of these masks is softer than anything Ive ever tried. They are barely big enough to cover my eyes, but do a pretty good job of keeping artificial light out. The drawback is the strap. As you tighten the clip, it gets moved to bad spots around my head and if I lie on the side its on--I wake up with a SPLITTING headache and have to take it off.They need to redesign this so that the clip doesnt press into your head while youre sleeping. If they can figure out how to do that then I might consider buying them again.

Headline: You have to put on your face in a very specific way for light to not come through, which is a problem when it moves even slightly. Often when you toss and turn at night, it will move around and light will end up slipping through. I tried fixing this by making sure the strap was on tight, but it simply didnt work and made it uncomfortable.
Review Text: I bought these a few months ago and have been using them. They were nice at first and I liked that it didnt press against my eyes. But, after two months, Ive managed to wear down all three somehow. They are basically flat and the "eye contouring" is gone.The straps are too low for me and bother my ears, but I tend to find most eye masks do so probably dont listen to me about that lol. Honestly, if not for it touching my ears, I dont notice it or the buckle. But, I do have a lot of hair in the way, so Im not sure?

Headline: I like the material
Review Text: Deforms too easily and puts pressure on the eyes

Headline: Doesnt quite meet the mark
Review Text: The mask moving slightly will allow light to get through

Headline: Looses All Structure When Washed :(
Review Text: 100% comfortable, does not keep light out properly.

Headline: Small which is a plus, but falls off in the night
Review Text: While these were comfortable to sleep in, they fell apart very quickly. Most of them ripped at the seam in the nose section within a month of using them. I hand-washed one, and the foam around the eyes deformed. the other two I wiped with a damp hand towel to clean after that. Helpful in a pinch, but the quality isnt worth the savings. I recommended paying extra for one that is well made.

This mask generally okay if using at night. For daytime sleeping lots of light gets in. I am a nightshift worker and use a mask to sleep during the day. Even little bits of light will throw my sleep patten off. The construction is flimsy. This means light leakage and that mask easily move out of place, i.e., off the eyes. Tightening is the about the only tool to fix these problems but, tightening mask so far as to block out light and hold firmly over eyes which then it is too tight and will touch the eyes. This is another annoyance that prevents easy sleep.For night time these do good to block out little lights while maintaining a comfortable adjustment. Not so much for the daytime when window drapes and other contraption cant stop all the sunlight.

Headline: Annoying crease in the center
Review Text: You cannot put these in a mesh laundry bag or hand wash, the structure of the eye sockets just droops down and they are very irritating when you wear them. I want to be able to wash these since they go on my face and especially near my eyes. For that reason, this product is not suitable for cleanliness. I am not sure how it has gotten so many stars and no complaints about keeping it clean. I cant use these anymore.

Headline: Not great if you are going to wear them all night and you need perfect darkness
Review Text: The idea is good: the mask does not touch the eyes. For me, the single strap is ineffective; masks I have brought from airlines usually have two straps (lightweight elastic bands), they stabilize the mask from above and below the ears. The single strap must be placed only above or below the ears, and in such a position, the mask slips up or down. It is good that the strap can be adjusted, but it is either too tight (gives a headache) or too loose (lets in light).

Headline: Masks are thin and the light entered around the bridge of nose.  When I tightened the strap, the flat top layer laid against my eye lids [not very comfortable especially if I blinked under the mask].  Just felt cheap and flimsy in comparison to my last mask made by MZOO.  I tried to save a few dollars, not to mention get three mask for the price of one.  What a mistake.  Trying another version made by Unimi that arrives tomorrow.  In the end, I immediately without reservation asked to return the mask.  On a final note, I have a big head [literally].  These also felt too small.  Subsequently a person with a small head might find them a better fit.  Nevertheless, the quality, density and overall feel of the product is just plain "cheap."
Review Text: These masks looked promising until I put them on and noticed the crease in the center which causes the cup to collapse into your eye.  With proper positioning, it works for me but I only need them for the 1-2 hours of daylight I sleep during. I imagine someone who tries to get a full 8-hour sleep in the daytime will find themselves adjusting frequently.  They are very soft, the strap is comfortable and the price is great.  Its a shame the design of the cup fails.  My guess is the crease allows you to flip up the bottom portion to see instead of needing to lift the whole mask up.  That is convenient, unfortunately at the expense of comfort and usability.

Headline: You get what you pay for
Review Text: Not great if you are going to wear them all night and you need perfect darkness.They are to flimsy to work well.

Headline: Ive purchased many sleeping masks like this. I love the idea of the shape that doesnt smoosh your eyelashes. This is a pack of three. There is one main one that is built better than the rest. It's a little thicker and is shaped better. The other two have this odd crease line gong through the eye area and this allows the cup to have a tighter, flatter strip. This is uncomfortable across the eye. Also, this allows the cup to sit incorrectly across the face and allows light around the edges. I threw away the two with the odd strip. I will not buy this brand again.
Review Text: Three might equal one; however, I still sent it back

Headline: the elastic wears out and they go completely flat in about 2 weeks of use. nice before that.
Review Text: The foam form leaves gaps and then the mask slides. Rather annoying instead of restful.  Also poor ventilation despite the gaps and waking caused by discomfort.

Headline: Doesnt blackout light
Review Text: I honestly didnt have high hopes given how cheap they were for a set of 3 but i needed backups for when i wash my good one, these literally feel liks a bra w no underwire on my face, gaps around the nose, looks like its padded around the eyes but its not, its the same thickness all around and as soon as you put them on even loose fitting the eyes cave in like when youre wearing a bra thats cup size is too big for you defeating the whole purpose of the cups for the eyes... needless to say as a night shift worker i need a mask that can help me sleep during the day, these aint it
nice at first...doesnt last 2 weeks

Headline: Does not stay on all night
Review Text: cant be too loose or to tight

Headline: I couldn't keep these. I'm not sure how anyone can use them. They smell like a Chinese sweat shop factory. Inhaling that all night would be awful. Came nicely packaged
Review Text: Cute colors, super soft fabric, good stitching that doesnt come loose like other sleep masks. It also has eye compartments that dont press down on your eyes as you sleep. And, no velcro closing! So no hair snagging which is great. Most sleep masks have velcro closures which snags hair or your bonnets/hair scarves if you wear them.CONS- doesnt blackout light. they cover my eyes but it doesnt get completely black and I think thats because of the fabric. also, the nose area doesnt fit perfectly, and light gets through there as well.- doesnt stay on. I find myself readjusting it in the middle of the night or Ill touch my face and wonder where it went and then see it on my pillow.- is not rigid, as some other reviewers have stated. if you want to wear it tight, the whole mask will collapse in the middle and hurt your eyes. so unfortunately, you can only wear it loose.I dont recommend these. Try the Bucky brand instead, they rule.

Headline: Wears outs after a few months. Gets gross quickly.
Review Text: Fits fine. Mostly blocks out light. Does not stay on your face at night

Headline: Not a one size fits all product
Review Text: The mask on the top is this product, the bottom one is another brand (for comparison). This size is not appropriate for a man, maybe a woman. If you move your eyes or forehead, or rest your head sideways, the smallest movement misalign the mask off your eyes, allowing the light to reach your eyes. Wouldnt recommend.

Headline: Runs small, leaks light
Review Text: They move when you move. Too tight on my eyes. Returned.

Headline: They poke into my eyes
Review Text: These dont block 100% of the light, but they do block most of it. It wore out much more quickly than expected (only lasted a few months before a seam split). But it got fairly gross after wearing it for a while. I suppose I could have laundered it more frequently. But I dont feel like laundering it more frequently than I wash my bedsheets. Ive switched back to a cotton bandana blindfold.

Headline: Big downgrade from the previous design
Review Text: I had high hopes for these sleep masks but they should have don't fit. The width of my face is larger than what is comfortable for these masks. I tried stretching it out and it didn't work. If you have a larger face I would skip this brand.

Headline: Soft & Lightweight but flawed
Review Text: These sleep masks are definitely on the small side compared to others I have bought in the past and so leak more light than others Ive used. Quality is pretty average.
I dont really see how these are for side sleepers. They arent spaced right or something, and they poke into my eyes.

Headline: I can tell if the lights are on.
Review Text: This is my second time buying this item, but the previous version had much deeper 'cups?? over the eyes which kept your eyelashes from getting smashed against your face. The new version has the same material (which is nice and soft) but they made the whole thing almost flat for some reason and now I can't even wear it for more than a minute. Why change what worked?

Headline: These face masks are junk. They have rough "melted" seams that will feel scratchy on your cheeks and the elastic band is garbage. Theres other pairs equal in price that have nice, sewn seams with higher quality straps. Avoid these.
Review Text: These get a star for being soft, lightweight, with a nice adjustable strap and another star for the great price. Unfortunately they fell short on everything else. The 'deep eye room?? they state is not even close to the one I currently have. My eyelashes and eyelids touch the inside of the cup area. Which is not comfortable and I can't imagine wearing it all night, having it resting on my eyelids which then make your eyelids smoosh against your eyeballs. I cannot imagine how my eyes would feel in the morning after a night of that. If I loosen the band more then the mask slides around and more light comes through the nose area. Speaking of nose area they also don't do a good job of blocking the light from coming through around there either.I had high hopes from all the good reviews, but I will be returning these and reordering the one I am currently using.

Headline: Product gave me chemical burns
Review Text: I've had other eye masks that blocked out light to the point I would not know if the lights are on. These do not. I would give them an 7/10 in blocking lights. They also have to sit just right to not let light in around the nose. Any small movement of your head may move them out of place.

Headline: I got these sleep masks after I left my usual one at home. The eye 'wells?? are not big enough and the eye part is not aligned correctly with the nose notch ' it kept slipping up on my head so that it didn't cover my eyes, even after adjusting it several times. I would buy the Bucky brand sleep masks over this any day. Don't waste your money on this.
Review Text: I am work night shift so need masks that cover my face. These leak light underneath my eyes. Would be great for travel but not for day sleeping.

Headline: No matter how I adjusted the strap tension, the mask would slide up my face so the bottom part of mask would be sitting directly on my eyes and not block out light. Uncomfortable and defeated the whole purpose. Soft material, but overall useless as a sleep mask.
Review Text: I have bought from this company 3 or 4 times before and loved the eye Masks I received. However, the Masks sent with me recent order are different than the ones I received in the past and are a much inferior product. I am terribly unhappy. The crease across the eye is very annoying and even the adjustable head strap is inferior. After only two nights of wear, it now has this  warped fold in the strap that makes it uncomfortable and rolled while wearing it. Lastly, the new design does not block light as well and I think it maybe because the face piece is smaller. They probably kept the same amount of fabric and then when they added the annoying 3D cups it took away from the fabric actually available on the face.Ill be going back to my old beat up one until I can find a new company that sells the quality Im looking for in a sleep mask. I definitely wont be ordering from this company again.

Headline: Too tight and not adjustable
Review Text: Yup. You read the headline correctly.After wearing the black mask for about 15ish minutes, the skin that was in contact with the mask became seriously inflamed & burned.Ive since washed the sleep masks three times; it seems to have solved the problem. Still: I woudnt recommend these to anyone. Theyre not so comfortable as to be worth chemical burns.ON EDIT: Got a message from vendor:"Thank you for your purchase and taking the time to write a product review.We are so sorry about all the inconvenience caused by the product. This is an extremely rare case.The sleep mask Plastic bags have an unpleasant chemical smell. The material of the eye mask is porous sponge, which may absorb the smell of plastic bags.These products are produced in factories and may bring some tiny dust. Before using the product, please wash it with clean water and dry it naturally, avoid wring dry, do not use the microwave oven or dryer drying.Please dont worry about the material of the eye mask.Thanks god, it did not brought you more losses. We are terribly sorry the sleep masks you received is defective and would like to know if we can send you a better one for replacement or assist you with a full refund. The better sleep mask with a gift box and it havent Plastic bags.Your super understanding and kindly reply will be much appreciated. Please give us a chance to make up for your loss!Best wishes!LKY DIGITAL"--00--Like I wrote earlier, Ive already washed & air-dried the masks. They dont seem to be causing issues any more. I wont be asking for a refund, and Im not particularly upset - just want to warn folks that if you buy these masks: WASH THEM FIRST or you risk hurting yourself.

The only thing I liked was the texture of the material. I ordered a set right before this one that did not block out light completely. I ordered these the same day that I returned the others. I open up my new ones and they are The EXACT Same ones! Same exact silver sealed envelope, wording, packaging exact same. Since they are the same, they Do Not completely block out light, they are not tapered to curve around the outside of the eye or nose. I will just spend the $ on (hopefully) one's that give measurements and contour properly.

Headline: I like the ability to adjust the mask to fit me.  It successfully blocks out light enabling me to get to sleep and stay asleep.
Review Text: Design great, stays in place however followed directions handwashed prior to first use with mild detergent and ended up with chemical burn around eyes for 5 days. Awful. Material does not breathe and is not good for your delicate skin. If they could somehow I corporate 100% silk with this design would be perfect.

I am in love with it and so thankful I got it as an early Christmas present!! Highly recommend!!

Headline: I slept well wearing this mask. It shields my eyes from all streetlight/ambient lighting, and it's a great value for a weighted eye mask. The weight is pleasant for everyday sleep and definitely something I'd reach for when a migraine strikes (both the darkness and the pressure will help).  You can adjust the strap for a good fit, but it's designed in such a way that hair won't get tangled in it. Also, the glass beads will need a little help with orientation. The core part of the mask is basically a bag sewn shut, with small contoured places for the eyes to keep out the beads. As a result, the beads freely flow in the outer part of the mask. I just shifted the beads around for even coverage across the entire mask, but if I had a migraine rooted in just one eye, I could easily shift the beads to add more weight to the affected area.
Review Text: This mask provides great relief from sore, itchy eyes.
It also helps with sinus pressure.

Headline: I'm a night shift nurse and these are the only thing that works to help me sleep thru the day time! They don't squish my eyeballs and o just rotate and throw them in the wash weekly.
Review Text: I just placed another order for LKY sleep masks.  I've tried others, but none compare to these.  They conform to your face providing a convex space for your eyes so the fabric doesn't touch your eyes. I have purchased others over the years, but these are the most comfortable, block out the light completely, and the adjustable band stays in place without pressure. Best of all there's no Velcro to get caught in your hair or make crinkly noises. I have several available as I like to hand wash them occasionally and always take a couple for travel or just in case. Highly recommend!!

Headline: I love the way these masks have an adjustable strap and how they block out the light and have space between the mask and the eyes.Use of eye masks result in an increased amount of REM sleep and less time spent between falling asleep and reaching REM sleep.Wearing an eye mask during sleep can improve alertness the next day. Sleep is crucial for alertness and for preparing the human brain to encode new information.I found this information online but I have experienced waking up feeling refreshed, more alert and having better reflexes. When you sleep, even though your eyes are closed, light can still seep through, which can disturb your rest.Do not use these only for travel, but for everyday use. Keep one in your purse or briefcase. It's amazing how one can feel relaxing with an eye mask.
Review Text: No pressure on the nose area (which I appreciate!) and still keeps light out! I can also open my eyes and my lashes do not rub against the mask. Great product!

Review Text: This is now my favorite type of sleep mask - weighted! I have a few others, but this one is my fav. The "beads" conform to your eyes & the weight puts pressure on your eyes which feels so good when my eyes are tired or if I have a slight headache. This mask is great for side sleeping. It does not dig into the side of my head, keeps the light out very well, even sleeping on your side. Only issue I have is that the strap on the back keeps coming off its hook when I take the mask off. It does not come apart when Im sleeping. Just something that happens when I take it off, so not a big deal. Havent tried to freeze or frigerate the mask, so cant attest to that benefit. I have a liquid filled freezable mask that feels great, so would guess this would feel good too, just not as intense.

Headline: Took some fiddling to get it comfortable!
Review Text: I have trouble sleeping unless Im in total darkness, so Ive tried a lot of sleep masks over the years. This one is very comfortable and blocks the light well. There is plenty of room for eye movement without the mask touching my eyelashes. The extra weight of the filling was slightly unusual at first but then i think it helped me to relax more. Headline: Umisleep Weighted Eye Mask
Review Text: A lot less heat build up than other masks, good fit, I like the weight. Need to be replaced after a few months, the seams holding the beads give up after a while.

This totally blocks out all light and its really comfortable on and around the eyes. The best feature, I would say, is that you can open your eyes without taking the mask off. This allows you to be woken by accident and then fall back asleep quickly and easily with little interruption to your sleep.Only issue is the strap is very poorly designed with a buckle that allows the strap to become contorted very easily. This can be uncomfortable on the sides of the head, as the strap becomes bunched and irritating.Im still happy with the purchase, but id have preferred one with a better strap.

Headline: I have migraines, so I got this hoping for some relief. It does not cure, but it does ease the migraine up some. It isnt so cold that it freezes your face like some masks. It isnt gel so you dont have to mush it around trying to get it just right, gravity and your face contour do it for you. The glass beads are really small in it, so no worry about large beads in it.
Review Text: It is a very nice mask, nicely weighted, and has an adjustable strap on the back for people with big or small heads (like me). Its also very comfortable. Unfortunately, the mask didnt fit me perfectly and I could see light coming out of the bottom of the mask, even after I adjusted the straps. I have a long nose so that could be why it didnt fit me perfectly, but if you are looking for total darkness and eye coverage then it might not work for you.

Headline: Softer & more comfortable than last one
Review Text: This eye mask has a good weight to it with depressions so theyre not as heavy on the eyeballs. The filling rounds the mask, which may be why this seems to let a bit more light in around my nose than typical masks. The strap is wider and seems better made than others I often see. Overall, it lived up to expectations and is well priced right now ($14.99 minus 30%). It came in a sealed bag in another zip bag (neither is meant to be a reusable storage bag).

Headline: Bulky With Uneven Distribution
Review Text: The Umisleep Weighted Cooling Sleep Mask was wonderful as a cooling therapy mask, but it didn't work as a sleeping mask for me.There's much to like about the Umisleep weighted cooling sleep mask. The fabric was nice and soft, it felt really good around the sensitive eye area. I put it in the freezer until it was chilled throughout and it was tremendously relaxing and therapeutic for my tired eyes. The 'V?? design in the middle kept the mask from touching my eyelids but the outer edges of my eyes were covered in soothing coolness. I know some would really like that feature as they're uncomfortable with the blurry vision that sometimes comes after using heat or cold on their eyes. I didn't experience any vision distortion with this mask. That chilled area is weighted, which feels really good and also caused the mask to hug my face nicely. (The cold lasts a generous amount of time.) The back strap is adjustable, so I was able to create the perfect fit. I was so relaxed from the experience that I fell asleep in my recliner.After I finished my first session with the mask I put it back in the freezer to rechill for later use. I grabbed it on my way to bed that night to see how I'd like it as a sleep mask. I immediately could see that this wouldn't be a 'total blackout?? mask, light filtered in around the edges. I laid back on my pillow, closed my eyes and began to drift away. At some point I turned on my side, which is when I realized this wouldn't be a good sleep mask choice for me. The weighted part of the mask that surrounded my eyes and had felt so glorious moments before was now presenting as a hard, uncomfortable lump between my face and my pillow. I shifted position a bit, but nope??. this wasn't something that could be made better. I took off the mask and went back to my old sleep mask.My final evaluation is that this makes a marvelous cold therapy mask. It's a good design and well made. It's very comfortable. It could also possibly be a good sleep mask if one only slept on their back. It felt great as I slept in the recliner, but when I'm in bed I change positions making it a poor choice for regular sleep use. It's an excellent mask, depending on how one uses it. It is also washable, a feature that's very much appreciated.****About me: Integrity is very important to me. Reviews Ive posted will be from items Ive had direct contact with. These are my honest opinions. I will not post a review for a product I have not had personal contact with.

Headline: Difficult to sleep in
Review Text: I really love the design of this eye mask. It is silky soft to the touch, puts pressure in all the right places (none on your actual eyes, but relieves the sinus area), and blocks out any light perfectly especially since it has an adjustable strap.My one and only complaint is that it is a bit bulky to wear and so, for a side sleeper like me, I have found that it either slides off in the middle of the night or makes me sleep at an angle I wouldnt normally choose. For that, it loses one star.

Headline: I like the look and feel.  The adjustable strap is great.  I still get little bits of light around nose if I move/rollover.  Better than others I have tried but not my unicorn perfect mask.
Review Text: Strap is very adjustable! BUT I had loosen it quite a bit to get a comfortable loose fit and I have a small head. Then it was too lose when i got out of bed!Material is very soft! Even the beads feel good against the face. BUT the beads are all over the place. You have to squish and shake from side to side to try and even them out. Eventually, the beads to the bottom seemed to work the best. Love the weight of the mask after i play with where the beads should be?Most importantly, there was still pressure on my eyes UNTIL I got the beads just right.And lastly there wasnt 100 percent black out without some pressure on my nose bridge. All of these things could be my weird face, and most were resolved with some fiddling. But it shouldnt be that hard to make it comfortable. All in all tho it does all that it claims once you take the time to adjust things EACH time you put it on..

Headline: I use an eye mask every night.  These are very comfortable.  I like that they are slightly concave over the eye area so there is no pressure on the eyes at all.  Completely blocks the light and is very comfortable to use, and not hot to sleep with.  2 thumbs up.
Review Text: This looks exactly as it does in the promo photos. No instructions were included. The material is stretchy, but soft, and there is a bit of weight to it. I was hoping for a bit more weight to it, honestly.  The two Vs in the mask are supposed to keep the mask off your eyes and lashes, and it does it, but they also let a bit of light in, so not exactly blackout if one opens their eyes. The strap is nice an stretchy, easy to make fit on the face and head.  The description states these have a cooling effect since its filled with micro glass beads. There is no cooling effect that I can detect right out of the package. theyll need to be placed in the fridge/freezer,

Headline: It is very comfortable to wear on your head.  But the eye wells are not deep enough, and it rides up on when you sleep.  So the edges rub against your eyes.

Review Text: The madk is very heavy and you can feel it on your face pretty much all the time. It is hard to focus on falling asleep.The string does not split and goes accross your ears. The other masks I used in the past have string split do one part goes under your ears and second part goes over your ears, without touching them. It is not a problem initially but ears do hurt during the night and the pain wakes you up. Because the string doesnt split you have to keep it over your ears (which causes mask to slip off the head upwards) or under the ears (which causes mask to slip off the head downwards). In every case it is hard to keep the mask on the face throughout the whole night. If you tighten string up it makes ears to hurt.I honestly dont like the product.The only positive I can say about it is that the holes in the mask are perfect size and you can quite comfortably open your eyes in it.

Headline: These are very soft and block light better than probably any other sleep mask (other than a blindfold) that Ive used. If youre shopping around for sleeping masks try this one first.
Review Text: I tried on many sleep masks before deciding to keep this one. Other masks that I tried pressed against my eyes, my nose, my ears, the back of my head when I lay on my pillow and it was very uncomfortable, and I couldn't fall sleep this way. This mask is super soft and super comfortable and blocks out the light as it should. The one downside is that on occasion, when it is very humid, the mask gets damp from sweat, and it is very slow to dry.

Headline: I cant pause this enough.  Light and noise blocking

The Velcro on this sleep mask took some getting used to because I dont have a large head, so there is a bit of the strip that isnt held down by Velcro. Nevertheless, the mask blocks all light, which results in me being complete knocked out after my head hits the pillow.

Review Text: I love how the product actually doesnt cause any ear pain from it being close to your ears, as well as how you barely feel it there when it is on. I saw another review wishing it coming in black and I second this suggestion so that the dark Gray doesn't discolor. Otherwise.. it's comfortable and keeps it dark enough for me at night.

Headline: overall its a solid product, blocks out nearly all light, comfortable, and soft. downside is the velcro combined with side sleeping. if you sleep on one side and depending on your head size, the velco will be between your head and the pillow. if you have a firmer pillow, the material will compress and that velcro will be felt directly on the side of your head and lightly stab you. its not really bad, but pretty uncomfortable on my perferred sleeping side and was irritating enough to keep me from being able to fall asleep.

Headline: Great

Headline: It's surprisingly pretty comfortable. I am extremely particular about how I sleep, even a little disruption in comfort will keep me up all night. I was struggling to find a sleeping mask that didn't bother my ears (I'm a side sleeper). This one has been the best so far!The only real downfall I've encountered is because I have fairly oily skin on my face. This thing is like a super oil absorber, so I can really only wear it twice before it needs to be washed. And when I wash it, laundry detergent alone doesn't do the trick, so I have to use some Dawn dish soap with it.It says to hand wash it, but I throw it in the washing machine and dryer with normal loads all the time. It's held up pretty well so far.
Review Text: Its super soft and pretty overall comfortable, I just wish there were extra space in the eye area

Headline: Very comfortable, I was worried it might be hit with some much coverage, but it stays cool and does a great job blocking light.

Im going to have to stitch it back on properly, or get a new one, and Ive only had it maybe two months

Headline: Good for side sleepers
Review Text: It is really soft and all, but the nose part is a bit uncomfortable for me.

Headline: Very comfortable but very warm
Review Text: I have to have complete darkness when I sleep, so when I bought this mask I had high expectations. The mask is very comfortable, however the Velcro on the back can be annoying at times. It does block out a good deal of light, but not around the nose area. Also, when you see reviews stating that the velcro loses its adhesive grip, they are 100% correct. After washing it got a little better, but after months of having it the velcro is not holding as well as it did before. If you are prone to sweating in your sleep, I do not recommend this mask. The Cotten is soft and comfortable, but can make your face hot during the night. I don't regret this purchase, however I do not believe it is worth $24 and would not purchase this item again. Try it out if you are curious and have the money, other than that this might not be the sleep mask for you.Ps. It makes my eyebrows hurt! Like when your hair has been in a ponytail all day and you take it out.

Headline: This is probably the best sleeptime related purchase Ive made. Im an incredibly light sleeper that needs complete darkness and silence to sleep and stay that way.This sleep mask is wide enough that it covers my eyes and most of my forehead; when I wear it theres zero light getting through. Its incredibly soft and doesnt rub my skin wrong. It secures with a thick velcro strap at the back. If you have curly hair, Id recommend sleeping with it piled on top of your head in a loose bun so the sleep mask doesnt flatten the top layer and ruin your volume or curl pattern the next day. Since it wraps around the head, it does cover my ears.It definitely doesnt block out sound but it does muffle enough that theyre not annoyances. If you have a partner that snores obnoxiously Id say pair the mask up with some ear plugs.My one complaint is that the fabric is likely to stain if you have oily skin or do a nighttime skin care routine. I myself have a bedtime routine that I top off with moisturizer, and I noticed a slight darkening on the front portion of the mask where it touches my skin. To help combat this, I wash the mask once a week in a delicate bag and havent noticed the dark portion worsening. It also helps to make sure it doesnt get too stretched out. This could be a complete non
Review Text: Super comfy, and a great fitBut I found light still came through the nose.. thats the major downside.Wouldnt recommend for anyone looking for a 100% black out

Headline: Extremely pleasant, soft cotton material. This is the first time I have had a wrap a sleep mask around my eyes like this. It was bit odd at first but you get used to it after a while. A big pro is that it fits comfortably on people with larger heads like me!
Review Text: This is a good sleeping mask. Its comfortable, adjustable, and blocks light very well. Ive already bought two and Im about to buy a third.Some downsides to the mask:1) While it never gets hot, on warm days it is less comfortable. After all, its wrapped around your face & will block any cooling you may want.2) Not machine washable. After a year of washing, the hooks&loops stop working.3) Doesnt always stay in place, this mask sometimes rides around my head so that my eyes dont line up with the masks eye-things. Not a deal breaker because the whole mask is comfortable anyway.

Headline: Best sleep mask Ive ever owned... But...

Headline: Not bad but could be better
Review Text: It blocks out 90% of the light except around my nose. Its very soft, and doesnt make me overheat or want to pull it off in my sleep. It did get very gross very fast and the fabric on the back tore around the Velcro. I will likely buy again anyway.

Headline: I don't regret buying, but would not replace it
Review Text: Extremely soft fabric that covers eyes well, blocks light completely and is very comfortable on the front. The strap at the back is a little thick and takes some getting used to because it props the head up a little if you use a firmer pillow. A thinner back strap would make this flawless.

Headline: Very Comfortable, But Leaks Light
Review Text: Most comfortable of many sleep masks I tested.Material very soft.Nose area, mostly stops light coming in. Probably better for people with flatter noses.Back strap is too thick if you are sleeping on your back, so it digs into back of head. Not very comfortable whixh is kinda the opposite of helping you sleep.

Headline: Very, very comfy, but not a perfect black
Review Text: The only part I didnt like about this mask is where the velcro joins at it is fairly uncomfortable if youre a back sleeper (which I am part of the night).  As such, I usually only use this mask as the light starts creeping in the window.

Headline: Good mask, some downsides
Review Text: The sleep mask was soft but it covers from top of forehead to tip of nose. The Velcro closing is strong but a little bulky if you sleep on the back of your head. Not a bad product just not as comfortable as I prefer.

Headline: Does Not Muffle Sound
Review Text: Its comfortable and has the right geometry to cover everything and block the light, but it covers your ears, so you might start to get hot in your sleep.

Headline: Works well, doesnt last long.
Review Text: The fabric is very soft. However it does hold heat a bit, so it may not be suitable for warmer climates or hot sleepers. A little bit of light does come in through the bottom, but this could just be because I have a large nose lol. If I could change one thing, I would add a bit of extra stuffing or a liner because light still gets through the fabric. Its not a problem for me, but if you need absolute darkness this mask might not be enough. I love the wide shape of this mask and the material. I might just alter the mask myself to make it block out more light...

Headline: Soft fabric that blocks all light

Headline: Decent, but potentially uncomfortable for back sleepers.
Review Text: Comfortable and works well. Ear plugs that come with it are not great, but in terms of blocking out light, this does a great job.

Headline: I have a small head so most head gears of any kind usually do not fit. This has incredibly long fastening strips so it could probably fot any head out there. The mask section is very large and covers my eyes,cheaks, forhead comfotably. It is padded enough that it doesnt press on my eyes or have gaps letting light irritate me or cause any air restrictions. The wide strap also lets me keep tight without discomfort or digging in. Also very easy to clean. I chuck it in with my shirts and it has held up great. The only draw back is that all of the features that make it so darn comfortable also put it a bit on the warm side but i believe when this one finally wares out i will replace it with the same product. Maybe try dif color but thats all id swap.

Headline: I've had this sleep mask for less than a year. I love the size, softness and blackout quality the best.After a few machine washing's though the Velcro began to wear out,  very  disappointing.
Review Text: I don't often leave reviews on items I purchase on Amazon (never actually), however, this face mask deserved a shout out.I'm adverse to black out shades because I love natural light and the look of sheer curtains. Living in Florida and bedroom window facing east, I had to find a comfortable eye mask to block out the streaming light at 6am. I normally hate eye masks because they never stay on, elastic is uncomfortable, eyelashes smushed, etc.This eye mask is SUPER comfortable and soft and truly does it's job blocking out all light.HOWEVER, I've only used it for a few months and the Velcro no longer sticks, at all, and I'm currently browsing for a new one. The Velcro became 'unsticky?? after just a few weeks, and within a few months, does not even close or stay on.Planning to get the same concept eye mask because it's perfect but trying a different brand this time that hopefully uses better quality Velcro??

Headline: Everything about this item is wonderful
Review Text: All the other masks come off somehow but this is the only mask that stayed on my head. Its very soft, we shall see how it holds up after a few washes

Headline: I've been literally been through a dozen sleep masks in search of the right balance of light blocking, comfortability on the eyes and nose, and a strap that doesn't annoy my ears or leave a mark. (For the record, I have a shaved head, so I'm likely more sensitive to the strap issues I've encountered)While I do wish this mask was a touch thicker and that I didn't feel any pressure on my eyes whatsoever, the fact is I've finally found the best overall balance of all necessities.Light blocking
Review Text: This sleep mask is exactly what I was looking for. I like my ears to be covered when I am falling asleep and sometimes its too warm to pull the sheet/blanket all the way up. I love how soft this mask is and I love how large it is. There is some sort of light padding inside the two layers of cotton. The velcro is easy to adjust. It does tend to slide up and off my head in the middle of the night but I dont mind because I just use it to help me fall asleep quickly. My only complaint is that it must be hand washed. Unfortunately my night time face creams have rubbed off onto the mask and hand washing isnt sufficient in getting it off. I am going to have to machine wash it and hope it comes through ok!

Headline: Comfortable to wear and blocks all light. Doesnt get caught on hair. No chemical smell.
Review Text: Love it...  first one lasted 6 months (is that good or bad?) ordering another now.

Headline: I have bought almost a dozen sleep masks, trying to find one that blocks light while also being comfortable with multiple cartilage piercings. Most masks get caught or press on the ears, either due to the design or due to shifting during sleep. This mask does neither. It fits over a larger surface area than other masks (covering my entire ears, forehead, and temples), but is a soft jersey fabric that doesnt yank or irritate.It does soak up moisture quite easily, so I will be buying several pieces in order to start a washing rotation. People who sweat heavily or have an oily complexion may want to do the same.
Review Text: Its great and comfortable to sleep in but I do notice some light coming in near my nose. Its manufacturered for a low bridge or an Asian fit. I wouldve liked for the nose area to be cut different for different nose shapes.

Headline: This is the best sleep mask I've ever had. Very comfortable & blocks out all the light.
Review Text: This sleep mask is very well made, and not heavy to wear. It is also easily packable on trips. It washes up really well, by hand or machine. It blocks excess light that might otherwise keep one from falling asleep. About the only con I have had is that, during warmer months it may cause you to sweat more when sleeping. But if you need a mask to block the light, this  works well, and is comfortably light weighted.

Headline: This is a game changer for me!  Since Ive been using the mask Ive had the most fulfilling sleep Ive had in a while.  Im actually mad that I didnt invest in this particular mask sooner.  Great product!
Review Text: HEY POTATO HEADS!!!This is it this is the one.  Its not perfect but its almost perfectThe not-so-good first, the velcro enclosure could be a little bit tighter.  also it gets flimsy with age these arent designed to last forever about 3 months.  But considering one to two months is as good as Ive ever add sleep masks last this is doing better than they are.About the good witch makes it worth buying:. It is very soft it fits large heads it might actually be too large for smaller or average heads but the velcro in back is very long so its got a huge range of adjustability so I would imagine anywhere from big up old potato heads like me all the way down to little girls.The fabric is extremely soft it does slightly put pressure on your eyelids but its easy to get used to it can be kind of stretchy and they are not kidding when they say you must hand wash this and lay it out to dry dont even put it in the dryer on cool wash it on cool laying out to dry even still its going to start to fall apart but youll get a good three or four months out of it at leastWhat I can do is it sits just above my nose and it goes all the way up to almost passed my forehead and then from side-to-side it covers my ears it covers my forehead it completely covers my ears and it attaches to the velcro in back kind of low not up on the back of my head but low on the back of my head you can get it as tight or as loose as you want.it doesnt really stretch the fabric stretches out over time but it is not stretch fabric so you may feel a little claustrophobic if you have a tendency to thatAll in all its not been any sort of problem for me it completely blacks out any light and with disposable ear plugs in my ears I never hear anything nor see any light peeking throughall in all its very comfortable especially for guys who have great big potato heads this is the one you should be getting if hats dont fit you or any of the other stuff doesnt fit you.Recommended and I will be buying from them from now on out. I have been extremely pleased

Headline: I sleep in a room with a ton of windows and its very bright. Unlike others, this sleep mask actually stays on y our head when you roll over on your side when asleep. It blocks out enough light to make it seem like you are in the dark. It fits comfortably over your nose and the strap in the back for a snug fit.My only con with this mask is after washing it, I had to readjust the head strap but you cant even call it a con since there is velcro
Review Text: Really soft, I love that it doesn't leave marks on my face. It doesn't block the light as well as other masks I've used.

Headline: This mask is so comfortable. It can be rolled up so it's compact for traveling. It's lightweight enough for comfort but not too much that it falls off your face. Great price too! It feels like good quality and should last some years of frequent use.
Review Text: Great sleep mask, but gets hot after a while

Headline: This is the best eye mask ever. I purchased one a few years ago and bought another two for my parents. They love it, too.
Review Text: Can get warm and it moves around a lot compared to the fake silk wrap around one I used to have. I do not really recommend it compared to the same style one made of a more silky material. Also, not well defined area for the nose.

Headline: Very good face mask
Review Text: Soft, puffy material and a storage pouch make this superior to the usual, cheap sleep mask (the flat kind).The lightweight, fluffy material doesnt have much presence, and theres no pressure on the front of your face.The long velcro strip on this mask allows easy adjustment, but I found it baaarely fits on my L/XL (hat-size) noggin. If youre XL (or larger) hat-sized, this will likely be too small for you.The storage pouch is nice-- no more dusty mask from your nightstand pressed into your face, or commingled with the junk in your travel carryon. It squishes down to go back into the pouch with minimal effort.The downsides? The limited size for those of us with big heads, and its much more expensive than the flat type of mask. That aside, its pretty decent.

Headline: It's soft and comfortable to wear, unfortunately the material doesn't block 100% of the light. It works for light coming from electronics in a dark room, but if you need it for blocking light in a well light room get something else.
Review Text: Not for summer nights

Headline: Large, soft and comfortable
Review Text: Used this sleep mask for awhile now and can say its quiet good actually, the only down side is the feeling when u sleep side ways but once u sleep it wont bother u, after all u cant find better than this in my opinion in this price, worth having specially when u go camping or traveling.

Headline: I recently upgraded from a cheap $5 mask so this was a massive improvement as far as comfort goes. I love how soft this mask is. I think it does a great job, the only reason it doesnt hit a 5 star is because it does still let some light in as well as the light will shine through the mask. So its not a complete blackout when wearing it, but it does a good enough job that its benefits outweigh its negatives. I havent used it with the ear plugs but I would imagine with how comfortable the mask is around the ears as well as how it would help keep the earplugs in all night I imagine it would work great. Overall great product.
Review Text: Lightweight comfy but...

Headline: Really soft and well crafted. The Velcro's section is even a bit reinforced which will definitely add to the life of it. It's large enough to fit around my head and my thick hair while comfortably covering my ears as well. Excellent buy!
